intro: Majorana scutellifolia, commonly known as the Mediterranean sage, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like mint and oregano. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and small, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to white. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or dry environments. Majorana scutellifolia is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine and culinary applications.
